title: The Washington Post
added: * [[Michelle Singletary]], personal finance columnist<ref>[https://www.washingtonpost.com/people/michelle-singletary/ "Michelle Singletary"], ''The Washington Post'' </ref>

title: The Washington Post
deleted: Several days after the January 6, 2021 [[Capitol attack]], the Post ran a story about activist/reporter [[John Earle Sullivan]] and his involvement in the riot.<ref>Tom Jackman, Marissa J. Lang & Jon Swaine (Jan. 16, 2021), [https://www.washingtonpost.com/nation/2021/01/16/sullivan-video-arrested/ "Man who shot video of fatal Capitol shooting is arrested, remains focus of political storm"], ''The Washington Post'' </ref> The article included links to videos made by Sullivan under his ''[[nom de guerre]]'' "Jayden X"<ref>Matthew B. Foulger (Jan. 13, 2021), [https://storage.courtlistener.com/recap/gov.uscourts.dcd.227101/gov.uscourts.dcd.227101.1.1.pdf "AFFIDAVIT IN SUPPORT OF CRIMINAL COMPLAINT AND ARREST WARRANT"] for [[John Earle Sullivan]] (including screenshots from Sullivan’s "Jayden X" video channels), District Court, District of Columbia Case 1:21-mj-00050-RMM Document 1-1 </ref> and stated: "Sullivan sold The Washington Post rights to use a portion of his video for a story on the shooting [of [[Ashli Babbitt]]]."  The article didn't reveal the amount of the Post's payment — court documents have revealed that similar agreements with media outlets paid Sullivan $35,000 by [[CNN]], $35,000 by [[NBCUniversal|NBC]], $5,000 by [[ProSiebenSat.1 Media SE#Red Arrow Studios|Left/Right, LLC]], and $2,375 by [[ABC Television (Australian TV network)|ABC]].<ref>(Feb. 16, 2021), [https://www.courtlistener.com/docket/59147023/14/united-states-v-sullivan/ "United States v. SULLIVAN Memorandum in Support of Pretrial Detention — Document #14"] District Court, District of Columbia Docket Number: 1:21-cr-00078 </ref>  Most of the Post's reporting<ref>Emily Davies, Marissa J. Lang, Katie Mettler & Peter Jamison (Sep. 18, 2021), [https://www.washingtonpost.com/dc-md-va/2021/09/18/justice-j6-rally-capitol-riot-dc/ " 'Justice for J6' rally starts and ends with small crowds and tight security"], ''The Washington Post:''  ". . . the protesters returned to the scene of a historically grievous attack on American democracy, . . . where poorly prepared police fought a losing, hand-to-hand battle against President Donald Trump’s supporters just over eight months ago . . . " </ref> and opinion writers have consistently blamed [[President Trump]] for the riot, including [[Dana Milbank]],<ref>[[Dana Milbank]] (Feb. 11, 2021),

[https://www.washingtonpost.com/opinions/2021/02/11/if-republican-senators-acquit-trump-they-will-own-violence-that-follows/ "Opinion: If Republican senators acquit Trump, they will own the violence that follows"], ''The Washington Post''</ref><ref>Dana Milbank (July 27, 2021), [https://www.washingtonpost.com/opinions/2021/07/27/jan-6-hearings-begin-republicans-side-with-terrorists/ "Opinion: As Jan. 6 hearings begin, Republicans side with the terrorists"], ''The Washington Post'' </ref><ref>Dana Milbank (Aug. 6, 2021), [https://www.washingtonpost.com/opinions/2021/08/06/we-cant-let-terrorists-rewrite-history-jan-6/ "Opinion: The losers of Jan. 6 are trying to sanitize their sedition"], ''The Washington Post'' </ref> [[Jennifer Rubin (columnist)|Jennifer Rubin]]<ref>Jennifer Rubin (Aug. 26, 2021), [https://www.washingtonpost.com/opinions/2021/08/26/jan-6-select-committee-means-business/ "Opinion: The Jan. 6 select committee's document request shows it means business"], ''The Washington Post'' </ref><ref>Jennifer Rubin (Sep. 6, 2021), [https://www.washingtonpost.com/opinions/2021/09/06/what-are-adam-kinzinger-waiting/ "Opinion: What are Adam Kinzinger and Liz Cheney waiting for?"], ''The Washington Post'' </ref>

and editorial writer [[Fred Hiatt]].<ref>''Washington Post'' editorial board (Jan. 6, 2021), [https://www.washingtonpost.com/opinions/remove-trump-incitement-sedition-25th-amendment/2021/01/06/b22c6ad4-506d-11eb-b96e-0e54447b23a1_story.html "Opinion: Trump caused the assault on the Capitol. He must be removed."], ''The Washington Post'' </ref><ref>''Washington Post'' editorial board (Feb. 10, 2021), [https://www.washingtonpost.com/opinions/trumps-trial-has-crystallized-the-horror-of-jan-6-the-senate-must-convict-him/2021/02/10/b43dcff6-6be4-11eb-9f80-3d7646ce1bc0_story.html "Opinion: Trump's trial has crystallized the horror of Jan. 6. The Senate must convict him."], ''The Washington Post''</ref><ref>''Washington Post'' editorial board (July 10, 2021), [https://www.washingtonpost.com/opinions/2021/07/10/jan-6-capitol-attack-was-fact-violent-insurrection/ "Opinion: The Jan. 6 Capitol attack was, in fact, a violent insurrection"], ''The Washington Post''</ref><ref>''Washington Post'' editorial board (July 26, 2021), [https://www.washingtonpost.com/opinions/2021/07/26/we-have-questions-about-jan-6-new-house-committee-can-answer-them/ "Opinion: We have questions about Jan. 6. The new House committee can answer them."], ''The Washington Post'' </ref>
